+    "\n\nGenerator of operation wrappers in Java.\n\n"
+    "This executable generates wrappers for all operations registered in the\n"

+    "Generated files are output to the path provided as an argument, under\n"
+    "their appropriate package and using a maven-style directory layout.\n\n";

+}  // namespace tensorflow

+  tensorflow::string output_dir;
+  std::vector<tensorflow::Flag> flag_list = {
+    tensorflow::Flag("file", &ops_file,
body:
Ah. To make sure I understand, what would the ops defined in `//tensorflow/core:control_flow_ops` result in? I believe:

- Package name: `org.tensorflow.ops.control_flow`
- Group name: `controlFlow`

Is that right?
Hmm...I can see this evolving as we go along. I guess, in the mean time perhaps  change from `--file` to something like `--name` and make it clear in the documentation that this is a snake-case name of the group of operations and is used to compute the package name?

As we make more progress, we can decide whether we want to move the package prefix out as a separate flag and/or provide additional flags for groups etc.
body_html:
Ah. To make sure I understand, what would the ops defined in //tensorflow/core:control_flow_ops result in? I believe:

  • Package name: org.tensorflow.ops.control_flow
  • Group name: controlFlow

Is that right?
Hmm...I can see this evolving as we go along. I guess, in the mean time perhaps change from --file to something like --name and make it clear in the documentation that this is a snake-case name of the group of operations and is used to compute the package name?

As we make more progress, we can decide whether we want to move the package prefix out as a separate flag and/or provide additional flags for groups etc.
body_text:
Ah. To make sure I understand, what would the ops defined in //tensorflow/core:control_flow_ops result in? I believe:

Package name: org.tensorflow.ops.control_flow
Group name: controlFlow

Is that right?
Hmm...I can see this evolving as we go along. I guess, in the mean time perhaps  change from --file to something like --name and make it clear in the documentation that this is a snake-case name of the group of operations and is used to compute the package name?
As we make more progress, we can decide whether we want to move the package prefix out as a separate flag and/or provide additional flags for groups etc.
